section.section: This section applies only in Washington County.
In this section, "Board" means the Board of License Commissioners.

text.section: The Board may issue a caterer's license to a holder of a pouring license or a Class B restaurant or hotel (on and off-sale) beer, wine and liquor license.

A caterer's license issued under this section authorizes the holder to provide alcoholic beverages at events that are held off the premises covered by the pouring license or the Class B restaurant or hotel license.
The holder shall prepare, deliver, and provide food as well as alcoholic beverages for consumption at the catered event.
Before a caterer's license may be issued, reissued, or renewed, the county health department shall approve the facilities that prepare the food.
A holder may exercise the privileges under this license only during the hours and days that are allowed under this article for the underlying pouring license or Class B restaurant or hotel license.

This section does not require a holder of an existing pouring license or Class B restaurant or hotel license to have a caterer's license for catering on the premises that is covered by the existing license.

The holder of a caterer's license shall:
Provide all the service employees to serve the alcoholic beverages at the catered event; and
Ensure that at least one of those employees is certified by an alcohol awareness program and on the premises at all times during the catered event.
